title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrewbruce.himni@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Searching the NPPES
text: NPPES NPI Registry Public Search free directory active National Provider Identifier (NPI) records. Healthcare providers acquire unique 10-digit NPIs identify standard way throughout industry. CMS supplies NPI, publish parts NPI record public relevance, including provider’s name, specialty (taxonomy) practice address. enables search providers NPPES (National Plan Provider Enumeration System.) information produced NPI Registry provided accordance NPPES Data Dissemination Notice. charge use NPI Registry.

title: Searching the NPPES
text: NPPES Application Programming Interface (API) faster alternative downloadable NPPES data files. allows systems access NPPES public data real-time, rather batched uploads. API retrieves data NPPES daily. API query return maximum 200 results per request. Skip field API let skip 1000 records. using two fields search criteria, can get maximum 1,200 records six requests.

title: Searching the NPPES
text: following basic example searching NPI using using prov_npi_nppes(). argument provider’s 10-digit National Provider Identifier:   returns tibble containing NPI searched (search), datetime query, outcome status column data_lists, list-column containing collection variables nested data frames:   variables returned follows:  created_epoch: date NPI issued enumeration_type: NPI Entity Type, either NPI-1(individual) NPI-2(organizational) last_updated_epoch: date information last updated provider number: provider’s NPI, listed NPPES  Note: last_updated_epoch / created_epoch dates Unix time. repeated basic list last_updated enumeration_date, respectively.  list-columns returned follows:   basic: Basic information other_names: names used provider addresses: Primary location mailing addresses taxonomies: Specialty classification related information identifiers: Various identifiers payer-specific IDs, CLIA numbers, etc. practice_locations: Provider’s practice locations endpoints: Information regarding provider’s endpoints Health Information Exchange (HIE)  Note: list-columns may available every provider. depends factors NPI type, incorporated individual status, subpart delegation, , quite simply, information provided NPPES providers.
code: # Load package library(provider)  # Query the NPPES API nppes_npi_resp <- prov_npi_nppes(1114499340)  # View the results nppes_npi_resp #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   search     datetime            outcome data_lists    #>   <chr>      <dttm>              <chr>   <list>        #> 1 1114499340 2022-09-08 07:32:34 results <df [1 × 11]> #> <list> #> └─S3<data.frame> #>   ├─created_epoch: "1546027807000" #>   ├─enumeration_type: "NPI-1" #>   ├─last_updated_epoch: "1592271738000" #>   ├─number: "1114499340" #>   ├─addresses: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─practiceLocations: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─basic: S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─taxonomies: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─identifiers: <list> #>   │ └─<list> #>   ├─endpoints: <list> #>   │ └─<list> #>   └─other_names: <list> #>     └─<list> #> S3<data.frame> #> ├─created_epoch: "1546027807000" #> ├─enumeration_type: "NPI-1" #> ├─last_updated_epoch: "1592271738000" #> └─number: "1114499340" #> S3<data.frame> #> ├─addresses: <list> #> │ └─S3<data.frame> #> │   ├─country_code<chr [2]>: "US", "US" #> │   ├─country_name<chr [2]>: "United States", "United States" #> │ title: Searching the NPPES

title: Searching the NPPES
text: search one NPI time, two options, first create unnamed list (using c() opposed list()) said NPIs:   pipe list prov_npi_nppes() using purrr’s map_dfr() function loop list:   Unpacking response similar, adding dplyr’s group_split() function chain. parameter entered group_split() must search.   Searching column NPIs data frame slightly different. ’ll create data frame NPIs list example:   can even chain search unpack function chains together using |>, R’s lovely pipe. , group_split() input column containing NPIs. Split purrr, split purrr:  46 columns wide, output fairly unwieldy, really depends need data.
code: npi_list <- c(1336413418, 1710975040, 1659781227, 1528060837) npi_list_resp <- npi_list |> purrr::map_dfr(prov_npi_nppes) #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   search     datetime            outcome data_lists    #>   <chr>      <dttm>              <chr>   <list>        #> 1 1336413418 2022-09-08 07:32:36 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 2 1710975040 2022-09-08 07:32:38 results <df [1 × 11]> #> 3 1659781227 2022-09-08 07:32:40 Errors  <df [1 × 3]>  #> 4 1528060837 2022-09-08 07:32:42 results <df [1 × 11]> npi_list_resp |> dplyr::group_split(search) |>                   purrr::map_dfr(prov_nppes_unpack) #> # title: Searching the NPPES
text: Several constraints implemented batter NPPES API invalid searches. input must 10 digits function throw error:   also must valid NPI. prov_npi_nppes() function checks validity using Luhn algorithm, per ’s implementation CMS (documented ):   Inputting letters throw error:   Luhn check catch letters wrapped quotes:   let quoted numbers :  long ’re 10 digits long.
code: prov_npi_nppes(123456789) #> Error: NPIs must have 10 digits. Provided NPI has 9 digits. prov_npi_nppes(1234567891) #> Error: Luhn Check: NPI may be invalid. prov_npi_nppes(abcdefghij) #> Error in is.factor(x): object 'abcdefghij' not found prov_npi_nppes("abcdefghij") #> Error: Luhn Check: NPI may be invalid. prov_npi_nppes("123456789") #> Error: NPIs must have 10 digits. Provided NPI has 9 digits.

title: Searching the NPPES
text: section outlines NPPES API’s documentation, going valid search inputs, constraints inputs, descriptions many possible outputs.  version API version {provider} uses version 2.1 number National Provider ID 10-digit number enumeration_type NPI type specified, types returned; criteria entered taxonomy_description Description provider's specialty taxonomy code unique 10-character alphanumeric code designates provider’s classification specialization. Examples descriptions Physical Therapist, Emergency Medicine, General Practice, etc. first_name Provider's first name applies Individual Providers. Trailing wildcard entries require least two characters entered (e.g. “jo*” ). use_first_name_alias Similar first name applies Individual Providers. Trailing wildcard entries require least two characters entered (e.g. “jo*” ). last_name Provider's last name applies Individual Providers. Trailing wildcard entries require least two characters entered (e.g. “jo*” ). organization_name Organization name Type-2 Entity applies Organizational Providers. types Organization Names (LBN, DBA, Former LBN, Name) associated NPI examined matching contents, therefore, results might contain organization name different one entered Organization Name criterion. address_purpose Identifies Provider’s Mailing Address Practice Location Address specified, results contain providers either Mailing Address Practice Location Addresses match entered address information. city City associated Provider’s address address_purpose Enter either APO FPO Military Address. state State abbreviation associated Provider’s address address_purpose used input. used, least one field, besides enumeration_type country, must populated. postal_code Postal code associated Provider’s address address_purpose Trailing wildcard entries permitted requiring least two characters entered (e.g., “21*”). country_code Country abbreviation associated Provider’s address address_purpose Can used input criterion long value selected “US” (United States). limit Number results returned Default value 10; can value 1 200. skip Number results skip Results meeting entered criteria bypassed 200 results. pretty Output pretty-printed checked, JSON output displayed easy--read format.

title: Searching the NPPES
text: Two categories health care providers exist NPI enumeration purposes: Entity Type 1 (Individual) Entity Type 2 (Organizational).  #### NPI-1: Individual Individual health care providers (including sole proprietors) may get NPI Entity Type 1. sole proprietor, must apply NPI using SSN, Employer Identification Number (EIN) even EIN. sole proprietor, may get one NPI, just like individual. following factors affect whether sole proprietor Entity Type 1: Number different office locations Whether employees Whether IRS issued EIN. incorporated individual single health care provider forms conducts business corporation. sole proprietor incorporated individual sole proprietor didn’t form corporation. ’re sole/solo practitioner, doesn’t necessarily mean ’re sole proprietor, vice versa. ’re individual health care provider ’s incorporated, may need get NPI (Entity Type 1) NPI corporation LLC (Entity Type 2).

previous_headings: API Documentation Overview > Terminology Notes > Enumeration Type
title: Searching the NPPES
text: Organization health care providers group health care providers eligible NPIs Entity Type 2. Organization health care providers may single employee thousands employees. example incorporated individual organization’s employee. organization health care providers made parts work somewhat independently parent organization. parts may offer different types health care offer health care separate physical locations. parts physical locations aren’t legal entities part organization health care provider (legal entity). NPI Final Rule refers parts locations subparts. organization health care provider can get subparts NPIs. subpart conducts HIPAA standard transactions (separately parent), must get NPI. Subpart determination makes sure entities within covered organization uniquely identified HIPAA standard transactions conduct Medicare covered entities. example, hospital offers acute care, laboratory, pharmacy, rehabilitation services. subparts may need NPI sends standard transactions one health plans. Subpart delegation doesn’t affect Entity Type 1 health care providers. individuals, health care providers can’t choose subparts subparts.

Information redacted necessary protect Medicare provider privacy. title: Overview of Provider
text: Accountable Care Organization Participants data presents overview information ACO participants Medicare Shared Savings Program (Shared Savings Program), including name, track status, number years program, contact information key personnel. NOTE: CMS migrates data new website redesign, datasets now listed Month Year instead Performance Year, datasets PY 2019A naming convention listed updated CMS monthly appear updated annually. Accountable Care Organization Skilled Nursing Facility Affiliates data presents overview information ACO SNF affiliates Medicare Shared Savings Program (Shared Savings Program), including name, track status, number years program, contact information key personnel. NOTE: CMS migrates data new website redesign, datasets now listed Month Year instead Performance Year, datasets PY 2019A naming convention listed updated CMS monthly appear updated annually. County-level Aggregate Expenditure Risk Score Data Assignable Beneficiaries data Medicare Shared Savings Program (Shared Savings Program) provides aggregate data consisting per capita Parts B FFS expenditures, average CMS-HCC prospective risk scores total person-years assignable beneficiaries Medicare enrollment type (End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD), disabled, aged/dual eligible, aged/non-dual eligible). Submitted data week ending 08/21/2022.   Submitted data week ending 08/21/2022.   Fiscal Intermediary Shared System (FISS) Attending Rendering dataset provides list attending rendering physicians FISS. FISS edits require Line Item Rendering Physician information transmitted providers submit combined claim. Claims include facility professional components, need report rendering physician practitioner line level differs rendering physician/practitioner reported claim level.   Hospital Service Area data summary calendar year Medicare inpatient hospital fee--service claims data. contains number discharges, total days care, total charges summarized hospital provider number ZIP code Medicare beneficiary.   Market Saturation Utilization Core-Based Statistical Areas (CBSA) dataset provides monitoring market saturation means help prevent potential fraud, waste, abuse (FWA). CBSAs geographical delineations Census Bureau-defined urban clusters least 10,000 people. Market saturation, present context, refers density providers particular service within defined geographic area relative number beneficiaries receiving service area. data can used reveal degree use service related number providers servicing geographic region. also number secondary research uses data, one objective making data public assist health care providers making informed decisions service locations beneficiary population serve. Market Saturation Utilization State-County dataset provides monitoring market saturation means help prevent potential fraud, waste, abuse (FWA). Market saturation, present context, refers density providers particular service within defined geographic area relative number beneficiaries receiving service area. data can used reveal degree use service related number providers servicing geographic region. also number secondary research uses data, one objective making data public assist health care providers making informed decisions service locations beneficiary population serve. Medicare COVID-19 Cases & Hospitalizations data provides COVID-19 cases hospitalizations data Medicare beneficiaries diagnosed COVID-19.   Medicare Claims Encounter Data  services January 1, 2020 November 20, 2021, received December 17, 2021.   Medicare Dialysis Facilities data provides information clinical patient measures Medicare-certified ESRD facilities, also known dialysis facilities. contains data patient characteristics, treatment patterns, hospitalization, mortality, transplantation patterns Medicare-certified dialysis facilities.   Medicare Fee--Service Public Provider Enrollment dataset includes information providers actively approved bill Medicare completed 855O time data pulled Provider Enrollment Chain Ownership System (PECOS). release provider enrollment data related provider information releases Physician Compare Data Transparency.   Medicare Fee--Service (FFS) Comprehensive Error Rate Testing (CERT) dataset provides information random sample FFS claims determine paid properly Medicare coverage, coding, payment rules. dataset contains information type FFS claim, Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) codes, provider type, type bill, review decision, error code.   Number Accountable Care Organization Assigned Beneficiaries County dataset provides aggregate data total assigned beneficiaries ACO county least one assigned beneficiaries resides. Assigned beneficiary person-year counts based certified ACO Participant Lists assignment methodology performance year.   Order Referring dataset provides information physicians non-physician practitioners, National Provider Identifier (NPI), type/specialty legally eligible order refer Medicare program current enrollment records Medicare.    Payroll Based Journal (PBJ) Nurse Staffing Non-Nurse Staffing datasets provide information submitted nursing homes including rehabilitation services quarterly basis. data include hours staff paid work day, facility. Examples reporting categories include Director Nursing, Administrative Registered Nurses, Registered Nursing, Administrative Licensed Practice Nurses, Licensed Practice Nurses, Certified Nurse Aides, Certified Medication Aides, Nurse Aides Training. also non-nurse staff categories provided data Respiratory Therapist, Occupational Therapist, Social Worker. datasets also include facility’s daily census calculated using Minimum Data Set (MDS) submission.   Performance Year Financial Quality Results data provides Medicare Shared Savings Program (Shared Savings Program) ACO-specific quality, expenditure, benchmark, shared savings/loss metrics, well summarized beneficiary provider information performance year Shared Savings Program.  Physician/Supplier Procedure Summary (PSPS) data provides summary calendar year Medicare Part B carrier durable medical equipment fee--service (FFS) claims. file organized carrier, pricing locality, Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) code, HCPCS modifier, provider specialty, type service, place service. summarized fields total submitted services charges, total allowed services charges, total denied services charges, total payment amounts.  dataset produced annually typically available July (.e., data CY2015 usually available July 2016).   Revalidation Clinic Group Practice Reassignment dataset provides information physician group practice reassign billing . also includes individual employer association counts revalidation dates individual physician well clinic group practice.   Revalidation Due Date List dataset contains revalidation due dates Medicare providers due revalidate following six months. provider’s due date fall within ensuing six months, due date marked ‘TBD’. addition dataset also includes subfiles reassignment information given provider well due date listings clinics group practices providers.   Revalidation Reassignment List dataset provides information reassignments providers due revalidation.   Medicare Value-Based Payment Modifier (Value Modifier) data contains performance results de-identified practices subject Value Modifier, practices’ quality cost tiers along applicable Value Modifier payment adjustment. Value Modifier provided differential payment Medicare Physician Fee Schedule based quality care furnished Medicare beneficiaries compared cost care performance period. Calendar Year 2015 first payment adjustment period Value Modifier based performance 2013. Calendar Year 2018 final payment adjustment period Value Modifier based performance 2016.    ATTENTION USERS Providers’ Opt-Status may end early due COVID 19 waivers. Please contact respective MAC information.   Payroll Based Journal (PBJ) Nurse Staffing Non-Nurse Staffing Datasets Payroll Based Journal (PBJ) Nurse Staffing Non-Nurse Staffing datasets provide information submitted nursing homes including rehabilitation services quarterly basis. code: cms_open_data_catalog <- "https://data.cms.gov/data.json" # Create polite version polite_req <- polite::politely( httr2::request, verbose = FALSE, delay = 2) # Create request req <- polite_req(cms_open_data_catalog) # Send and save response resp <- req |> httr2::req_url_query() |> httr2::req_throttle(50 / 60) |> httr2::req_perform() # Parse JSON response and save results results <- resp |> httr2::resp_body_json( check_type = FALSE, simplifyVector = TRUE) results_dataset <- results$dataset |> tidyr::unnest(bureauCode) |> tidyr::unnest(language) |> tidyr::unnest(programCode) |> tidyr::unnest(references) |> tidyr::unnest(theme) results_dataset |> dplyr::select(title, description) |> knitr::kable() |> kableExtra::scroll_box( height = "500px", fixed_thead = TRUE) For the 2019 Medicare Post-Acute Care & Hospice by Provider and Service datasets only, we have modified the data for SNFs presented. Specifically, SNF data are reported in a separate file and only cover the period between January 1, 2019 and September 30, 2019.  This dataset can be found as a downloadable report under ‘Resources.’  More information can be found in the Methodology and FAQ documents. results_dataset |> dplyr::select(dataset = title, time_period = temporal, distribution, identifier) |> tidyr::unnest(distribution) |> dplyr::filter(dataset == "Medicare Physician & Other Practitioners - by Provider and Service") |> dplyr::filter(format == "API") |> dplyr::select(title, accessURL, temporal, modified) |> knitr::kable() |> kableExtra::scroll_box( height = "500px", fixed_thead = TRUE)

title: Access Public Healthcare Provider Data
text: goal {provider} provide performant reliable open-source tools facilitate easy access healthcare provider data publicly available APIs & sources.

title: Access Public Healthcare Provider Data
text: can install development version provider GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("andrewallenbruce/provider")  # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("andrewallenbruce/provider")

what: Search the NPPES by A Provider’s NPI
title: Access Public Healthcare Provider Data
text: Enter 10-digit NPI wish search prov_npi_nppes():  returns response form data frame NPI searched , date & time search performed, outcome (results means search successful, errors, something went wrong) column called data_lists:   data_lists nested list-column. can access inner lists using $ operator, can get better sense hierarchical structure list columns using lobstr’s tree() function:   exposes seven nested list-columns, using prov_nppes_unpack() function, can untangle mess:   final tidied results:
code: # Load library library(provider)  # Query the NPPES API nppes_npi_response <- prov_npi_nppes(1528060837) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   search     datetime            outcome data_lists    #>   <chr>      <dttm>              <chr>   <list>        #> 1 1528060837 2022-09-08 02:52:15 results <df [1 × 11]> lobstr::tree(nppes_npi_response$data_lists,               max_depth = 2) #> <list> #> └─S3<data.frame> #>   ├─created_epoch: "1117631856000" #>   ├─enumeration_type: "NPI-1" #>   ├─last_updated_epoch: "1183957886000" #>   ├─number: "1528060837" #>   ├─addresses: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─practiceLocations: <list> #>   │ └─<list> #>   ├─basic: S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─taxonomies: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─identifiers: <list> #>   │ └─S3<data.frame>... #>   ├─endpoints: <list> #>   │ └─<list> #>   └─other_names: <list> #>     └─<list> # Unpack NPPES response nppes_npi_unpacked <- prov_nppes_unpack(nppes_npi_response)
